newsitem.title: CHINA: China plans markets in Three Gorges area.
newsitem.headline: China plans markets in Three Gorges area.

text.p: China plans to set up wholesale markets and retail outlets around the Three Gorges dam on the Yangtze River to meet demand linked to the massive project, the Xinhua news agency said on Wednesday.

The Ministry of Internal Trade aimed to set up 82 wholesale markets selling products such as rolled steel, timber and building materials, and 194,000 retail outlets, including 165 major department stores, by 2010, it said.

Other retail outlets would include chain stores, cold storage centres and wharfs. The Ministry was also trying to promote local tourism and catering industries and attract foreign investment to the area, Xinhua said.
The Three Gorges Project, launched in 1995, is the world's largest water-control project, requiring investment of $25 billion. It is expected to be completed by 2009.
